heading: Buildings and structures that are potentially structurally compromised
text:
For purposes of this article “potentially
compromised” shall include a building or structure that has had an open roof for sixty days or longer, that has been shored and
braced or otherwise temporarily safeguarded pursuant to an emergency declaration issued by the commissioner, that has been
subject to a precept as a compromised structure under section 216.1.1 of this code or that may have suffered structural damage by
fire or any other cause as determined by the commissioner.
